wonderswancolor.name: Wonderswan Color
wonderswancolor.description: Powered by a 16-bit central processing unit, it took advantage of a low price point and long battery life in comparison to its competition

scummvm.name: Scumm VM
scummvm.description: Play the classic 'Point and Click' graphic adventure games from different platforms and systems like MS-DOS, C64, Apple II, or PC

segacd.name: Sega Genesis CD
segacd.description: CD-ROM add-on to the Genesis, it launched many FMV games, including the infamous Night Trap, which led to the creation of the ESRB

sega32x.name: Sega Genesis 32x
sega32x.description: Designed to expand the power of the Genesis and serve as a transitional console into the 32-bit era until the release of the Sega Saturn

pc88.name: NEC PC-88
pc88.description: Lineup of Japanese 16-bit and 32-bit personal computers manufactured by NEC from 1982 to 2000

megacd.name: Sega MegaCD
megacd.description: CD-ROM add-on to the Megadrive, it launched many FMV games, including the infamous Night Trap, which led to the creation of the ESRB

megadrive.name: Sega Megadrive
megadrive.description: Sega's third console and the successor to the Master System. First released as the Mega Drive in Japan

supergrafx.name: SuperGrafx
supergrafx.description: The SuperGrafx is an upgraded version of the PC Engine. Only six retail games were produced which took advantage of the improved hardware

pcenginecd.name: PC-Engine CD
pcenginecd.description: Add-on attachment for the PC Engine. The add-on allows core versions of the console to play PC Engine games in CD-ROM format

naomi.name: Sega Naomi
naomi.description: A development of the Dreamcast home game console, the NAOMI and Dreamcast share the same hardware components.

ps2.name: Sony Playstation 2
ps2.description: The PlayStation 2 is the best-selling video game console of all time, selling over 155 million units.

pcengine.name: PC-Engine
pcengine.description: Originally intended to compete with the NES, it ended up competing with the Sega Genesis, and later on the Super Nintendo

pcenginecd.name: PC-Engine CD
pcenginecd.description: Add-on attachment for the PC Engine. The add-on allows core versions of the console to play PC Engine games in CD-ROM format

pc98.name: NEC PC-98
pc98.description: Lineup of Japanese 16-bit and 32-bit personal computers manufactured by NEC from 1982 to 2000

neogeocd.name: Neo Geo CD
neogeocd.description: Originally launched as the MVS coin-operated arcade machine. It was ranked 19th out of 25 best video game consoles of all time

ps3.name: Sony Playstation 3
ps3.description: The PlayStation 3 (PS3) is a home video game console developed by Sony Computer Entertainment. The successor to the PlayStation 2, it is part of the PlayStation brand of consoles.

msx.name: MSX
msx.description: MSX is a standardized home computer architecture, conceived as an attempt to create unified standards among various hardware makers

msx2.name: MSX 2
msx2.description: MSX2 is a standardized home computer architecture, conceived as an attempt to create unified standards among various hardware makers

n64.name: Nintendo 64
n64.description: The N64 was the last major home console to use the cartridge as its primary storage format until Nintendo's seventh console, the Nintendo Switch

ngpc.name: Neo Geo Pocket Color
ngpc.description: The Neo Geo Pocket Color is the successor to SNK's monochrome Neo Geo Pocket, with the Color being fully backward compatible

pico8.name: Pico 8
pico8.description: PICO-8 is a virtual machine and game engine created by Lexaloffle Games.

n3ds.name: Nintendo 3DS
n3ds.description: The handheld's most prominent feature is its ability to display stereoscopic 3D effects without the use of 3D glasses or additional accessories.

segacd.name: Sega SegaCD
segacd.description: CD-ROM add-on to the Megadrive, it launched many FMV games, including the infamous Night Trap, which led to the creation of the ESRB

3do.name: 3DO
3do.description: The 3DO Interactive Multiplayer (often called simply the 3DO), is a home video game console platform developed by The 3DO Company

switch.name: Nintendo Switch
switch.description: The console itself is a tablet that can either be docked for use as a home console or used as a portable device, making it a hybrid console.

fbn.name: Final Burn Neo
fbn.description: Coin-operated entertainment machines. The golden age is defined as a period between the late 1970s and ending in the mid-1980s

zxspectrum.name: Sinclair ZX Spectrum
zxspectrum.description: The Spectrum was among the first mainstream-audience home computers in the UK, similar in significance to the Commodore 64 in the USA

famicom.name: Famicom Disk System
famicom.description: The Family Computer is a peripheral for Nintendo's Family Computer home video game console, released only in Japan

arcade.name: M.A.M.E.
arcade.description: Coin-operated entertainment machines. The golden age is defined as a period between the late 1970s and ending in the mid-1980s

gba.name: GameBoy Advance
gba.description: Successor to the Game Boy Color. Market competitors at the time were the Neo Geo Pocket Color, Wonder Swan, GP32 and the N-Gage

fba.name: Final Burn Alpha
fba.description: Coin-operated entertainment machines. The golden age is defined as a period between the late 1970s and ending in the mid-1980s

gc.name: Nintendo GameCube
gc.description: The Nintendo GameCube is the successor to the Nintendo 64 and is the first Nintendo console to use optical discs as its primary storage medium

gamegear.name: Sega GameGear
gamegear.description: The Game Gear shares much of its hardware with the Master System and is able to play its own titles as well as those of the Master System

gbc.name: GameBoy Color
gbc.description: The Game Boy Color features a color screen. It is slightly thicker and taller and features a slightly smaller screen than the Game Boy Pocket

mastersystem.name: Sega Master System
mastersystem.description: Succeeding the SG-1000, the Master System was released as a direct competitor to the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES)

gameandwatch.name: Game & Watch
gameandwatch.description: Line of handheld electronic games produced by Nintendo from 1980 to 1991. Created by game designer Gunpei Yokoi

intellivision.name: Intellivision
intellivision.description: The Intellivision is a home video game console released by Mattel Electronics, and was in direct competition with the Atari 2600

gb.name: Nintendo GameBoy
gb.description: Nintendo's second handheld system following the Game & Watch series. It mainly competed with Game Gear and Lynx

c64.name: Commodore 64
c64.description: The C64 is listed in the Guinness World Records as the highest-selling single computer model of all time.

snes.name: Super Nintendo
snes.description: Nintendo's second home console introduced advanced graphics and sound capabilities compared with other systems at the time

genesis.name: Sega Genesis
genesis.description: Sega's third console and the successor to the Master System. Released in North America as the Genesis

c16.name: COMMODORE 16
c16.description: Home computer made by Commodore International, intended to be an entry-level computer to replace the VIC-20

dreamcast.name: Sega Dreamcast
dreamcast.description: The Dreamcast was Sega's final home console, marking the end of the company's 18 years in the console market

tg-cd.name: TurboGrafx CD
tg-cd.description: Add-on attachment for the TurboGrafx-16. The add-on allows core versions of the console to play TurboGrafx-16 games in CD-ROM format

xbox.name: Microsoft Xbox
xbox.description: The Xbox is a home video game console and the first installment in the Xbox series of video game consoles manufactured by Microsoft. It was released as Microsoft's first foray into the gaming console market.

trs-80.name: COCO TRS-80
trs-80.description: Sold by Tandy through their RadioShack stores. It is one of the earliest mass-produced home computers.

colecovision.name: Coleco Vision
colecovision.description: The ColecoVision offered a closer experience to more powerful arcade game systems compared to competitors such as the Atari 2600.

vectrex.name: Vectrex
vectrex.description: Vector display based home video game console that was developed by Western Technologies Smith Engineering.

cps.name: CAPCOM SYSTEM I
cps.description: The CPS is an arcade system board developed by Capcom that ran game software stored on removable ROM cartridges.

vic20.name: COMMODORE VIC-20
vic20.description: The VIC-20 was the first computer of any description to sell one million units.

cps2.name: CAPCOM SYSTEM II
cps2.description: Arcade board that Capcom first used for Super Street Fighter II. It was the successor to their previous CPS.

virtualboy.name: Nintendo VirtualBoy
virtualboy.description: It was marketed as the first console capable of displaying stereoscopic 3D graphics using a parallax effect to create the illusion of depth.

wii.name: Nintendo Wii
wii.description: The Wii introduced the Wii Remote controller, which can be used as a handheld pointing device and detects movement in three dimensions.

cps3I.name: CAPCOM SYSTEM III
cps3I.description: The last proprietary system board Capcom would produce before moving on to the Dreamcast-based Naomi platform.

daphne.name: Daphne
daphne.description: Converged device and home video game console capable of playing Laserdiscs, Compact Discs, console games, and LD-G karaoke discs.

wiiu.name: Nintendo WiiU
wiiu.description: Successor to the Wii and the first eighth-gen video game console, as it competed with Microsoft's Xbox One and Sony's PS4.

wonderswan.name: Wonderswan
wonderswan.description: Powered by a 16-bit central processing unit, it took advantage of a low price point and long battery life in comparison to its competition.

x68000.name: X68000
x68000.description: The X68000 is a home computer, sold only in Japan. In terms of hardware, the X68K was very similar to arcade machines of the time.

atari7800.name: Atari 7800
atari7800.description: Almost fully backward-compatible with the Atari 2600, the 7800 was the first console to have backward compatibility without the use of additional modules.

Super Famicom.name: Super Famicom
Super Famicom.description: Nintendo's second home console introduced advanced graphics and sound capabilities compared with other systems at the time.

Amstrad CPC.name: Amstrad CPC
Amstrad CPC.description: The Amstrad CPC is a series of 8-bit home computers. The CPC series was pitched against other home computers and enjoyed a strong supply of game software.

Amiga.name: Amiga
Amiga.description: The original model was part of a wave of 16 and 32 bit computers that featured 256KB or more of RAM, mouse-based GUIs, and improved graphics & audio.

Amiga CD32.name: Amiga CD32
Amiga CD32.description: The original model was part of a wave of 16 and 32 bit computers that featured 256KB or more of RAM, mouse-based GUIs, and improved graphics & audio.

Amiga 1200.name: Amiga 1200
Amiga 1200.description: The CD32 is part of a family of Amiga computers and other hardware. It uses CD-ROM as its storage medium. It was based on Commodore's Advanced Graphics Architecture chipset, and is of similar specification to the Amiga 1200 personal computer.

Amiga 600.name: Amiga 600
Amiga 600.description: The CD32 is part of a family of Amiga computers and other hardware. It uses CD-ROM as its storage medium. It was based on Commodore's Advanced Graphics Architecture chipset, and is of similar specification to the Amiga 1200 personal computer.

MS-DOS.name: MS-DOS
MS-DOS.description: MS-DOS is an operating system for x86-based personal computers mostly developed by Microsoft.

atari5200.name: Atari 5200
atari5200.description: Home video game console that was introduced as a higher-end complementary console for the popular Atari 2600.

apple2.name: Apple ][
apple2.description: One of the first highly successful mass-produced microcomputer products, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak.

sega32x.name: Sega Genesis 32x
sega32x.description: Designed to expand the power of the Genesis and serve as a transitional console into the 32-bit era until the release of the Sega Saturn.

atari2600.name: Atari 2600
atari2600.description: The Atari 2600 is credited with popularizing the use of microprocessor-based hardware and ROM cartridges containing game code.

sg-1000.name: Sega SG-1000
sg-1000.description: Sega's first entry into the home video game hardware business provided the basis for the more successful Master System.

atari800.name: Atari 800
atari800.description: The Atari 8-bit family is a series of 8-bit home computers. All of the machines in the family are technically similar and differ primarily in packaging.

psvita.name: psvita
psvita.description: The Vita's design was intended to meld the experience of big-budget, dedicated video game platforms with the then up-and-coming trend of mobile gaming.

atarijaguarcd.name: Atari Jaguar CD
atarijaguarcd.description: Sixth and last programmable console to be developed under the Atari brand, Atari marketed the Jaguar as being the first 64-bit video game console.

atarijaguar.name: Atari Jaguar
atarijaguar.description: Sixth and last programmable console to be developed under the Atari brand, Atari marketed the Jaguar as being the first 64-bit video game console.

atarist.name: Atari ST
atarist.description: The Atari ST is a line of home computers from Atari Corporation and the successor to the Atari 8-bit family.

atarilynx.name: Atari Lynx
atarilynx.description: The Lynx was the world's first handheld electronic game with a color LCD and was also notable for its advanced graphics and ambidextrous layout.

atomiswave.name: Atomiswave
atomiswave.description: Custom arcade system board and cabinet from Sammy Corporation. It is based on Sega's Dreamcast system board.

psp.name: Sony Playstation Portable
psp.description: Sony's first handheld, it was also the first real competition to Nintendo handhelds since the Game Gear.

psx.name: Sony Playstation
psx.description: The Sony PlayStation primarily competed with the Nintendo 64 and the Sega Saturn as part of the fifth generation of video game consoles.

saturn.name: Sega Saturn
saturn.description: Fifth generation home video game console developed by Sega and successor to the successful Sega Genesis.

xbox360.name: Microsoft Xbox 360
xbox360.description: The Xbox 360 is a home video game console developed by Microsoft. As the successor to the original Xbox, it is the second console in the Xbox series.
